Kim Yong Nam Sends Greetings to Syrian President
Greetings to Syrian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Sends Greetings to Syrian President 
    Pyongyang, March 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today sent a message of greetings to Bashar al Assad, president of Syria, on the occasion of the 41st anniversary of the  March 8 revolution in Syria.
 The message said that the Korean people are sincerely rejoiced over the great progress made by the Syrian people in the work for independent development and prosperity of the country under the correct leadership of the Arab Socialist Baath Party of Syria after the victory of the revolution and extend full support and firm solidarity to the Syrian Arab people's cause of justice.    
 Expressing the belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger, it wished the president and the people of Syria greater success in their struggle to retake the occupied Golan Heights, achieve the fair and comprehensive peace in the Middle East and develop and modernize the country.

Large Mosaic Mural Built at Ryongsong Machine Complex 
    Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- A large mosaic mural "The Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung arousing the workers to effect another great revolutionary surge" has been built at the Ryongsong Machine Complex.
 Represented in the mural, 13 metres wide and 12 metres high, is the image of tender-hearted President Kim Il Sung encouraging the workers to perform feats in a new struggle.    
 An unveiling ceremony of the mural was held on the spot.

articles.content:
North Side's Delegation Returns
    Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The north side's delegation led by Choe Yong Gon, vice-minister of Construction and Building-Materials Industries who is the north side's chairman of the North-South Committee for the Promotion of Economic Cooperation, returned here today after participating in the 8th meeting of the committee held in Seoul.
 The delegation was met at the airport by Jong Mun San, chief secretary of the DPRK Cabinet, Jong Un Op, chairman of the National Economic Cooperation Federation, and other officials concerned.

articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves for Czech Republic and Britain
    Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly headed by its Chairman Choe Thae Bok left here today to visit the Czech Republic and Britain.
 It was seen off at the airport by Kang Nung Su, vice-chairman of the SPA, and David Arthur Slinn, British ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.content:
Congratulations to Russian Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a congratulatory message to Mikhail Yefimovich Fradkov upon his appointment as prime minister of the government of the Russian Federation.
 Expressing belief that the relations of economic cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in various fields in conformity with the DPRK-Russia relations developing favorably day by day on the basis of the special relationship between the two heads of state, the message sincerely wished him good health and greater success in his responsible work.
